meanings.definition: Relating to or produced by tomography.
meanings.sent1: The tomographic image showed a clear view of the inside of the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used a tomographic scan to examine the patient's brain.
meanings.sent3: The tomographic picture of the cake made it look like a delicious masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a tomographic scan, capturing every detail of the event.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was so detailed, it resembled a tomographic image of reality.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of creating a detailed image of a cross-section of a body part.
meanings.sent1: The tomographic view of the bone structure helped the surgeon plan the operation.
meanings.sent2: A tomographic technique was used to create a 3D model of the heart.
meanings.sent3: The tomographic image of the tree trunk revealed hidden patterns within.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a tomographic machine, analyzing every aspect of the problem.
meanings.sent5: The detective's investigation was like a tomographic scan, revealing layers of evidence.
